CLIENT -> SERVER:     /* What it does: Remove spaces around the email design added by some email clients. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* Beware: It can remove the padding / margin and add a background color to the compose a reply window. */

CLIENT -> SERVER:         body {

CLIENT -> SERVER:         * {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Centers email on Android 4.4 */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         div[style*="margin: 16px 0"] {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             margin: 0 !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Stops Outlook from adding extra spacing to tables. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         table,
CLIENT -> SERVER:         td {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             mso-table-lspace: 0pt !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             mso-table-rspace: 0pt !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Fixes webkit padding issue. Fix for Yahoo mail table alignment bug. Applies table-layout to the first 2 tables then removes for anything nested deeper. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         table {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             border-spacing: 0 !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             border-collapse: collapse !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             table-layout: fixed !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             margin: 0 auto !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER:         table table table {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             table-layout: auto;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Prevents Windows 10 Mail from underlining links despite inline CSS. Styles for underlined links should be inline. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         a {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             text-decoration: none;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Uses a better rendering method when resizing images in IE. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         img {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             -ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER:

CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* Beware: It can remove the padding / margin and add a background color to the compose a reply window. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         html,
CLIENT -> SERVER:         body {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             margin: 0 auto !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             padding: 0 !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             height: 100% !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             width: 100% !important;

CLIENT -> SERVER:         * {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }

CLIENT -> SERVER:         div[style*="margin: 16px 0"] {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             margin: 0 !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Stops Outlook from adding extra spacing to tables. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         table,
CLIENT -> SERVER:         td {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             mso-table-lspace: 0pt !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             mso-table-rspace: 0pt !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Fixes webkit padding issue. Fix for Yahoo mail table alignment bug. Applies table-layout to the first 2 tables then removes for anything nested deeper. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         table {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             border-spacing: 0 !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             border-collapse: collapse !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             table-layout: fixed !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             margin: 0 auto !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER:         table table table {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             table-layout: auto;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Prevents Windows 10 Mail from underlining links despite inline CSS. Styles for underlined links should be inline. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         a {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             text-decoration: none;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Uses a better rendering method when resizing images in IE. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         img {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             -ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER:

CLIENT -> SERVER:             line-height: inherit !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }

CLIENT -> SERVER:            display: none !important;

CLIENT -> SERVER:        }

CLIENT -> SERVER:         table,
CLIENT -> SERVER:         td {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             mso-table-lspace: 0pt !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             mso-table-rspace: 0pt !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Fixes webkit padding issue. Fix for Yahoo mail table alignment bug. Applies table-layout to the first 2 tables then removes for anything nested deeper. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         table {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             border-spacing: 0 !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             border-collapse: collapse !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             table-layout: fixed !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             margin: 0 auto !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER:         table table table {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             table-layout: auto;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Prevents Windows 10 Mail from underlining links despite inline CSS. Styles for underlined links should be inline. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         a {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             text-decoration: none;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Uses a better rendering method when resizing images in IE. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         img {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             -ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }

CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Fixes webkit padding issue. Fix for Yahoo mail table alignment bug. Applies table-layout to the first 2 tables then removes for anything nested deeper. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         table {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             border-spacing: 0 !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             border-collapse: collapse !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             table-layout: fixed !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             margin: 0 auto !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }

CLIENT -> SERVER:         a {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             text-decoration: none;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER:

CLIENT -> SERVER: @import url(https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Roboto:100,100italic,300,300italic,400,400italic,500,500italic,700,700italic,900,900italic&subset=latin,latin-ext,cyrillic,cyrillic-ext,greek-ext,greek,vietnamese);
CLIENT -> SERVER:     /* What it does: Remove spaces around the email design added by some email clients. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* Beware: It can remove the padding / margin and add a background color to the compose a reply window. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         html,
CLIENT -> SERVER:         body {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             margin: 0 auto !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             padding: 0 !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             height: 100% !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             width: 100% !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER: 			font-family:Roboto;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Stops email clients resizing small text. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         * {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Centers email on Android 4.4 */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         div[style*="margin: 16px 0"] {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             margin: 0 !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Stops Outlook from adding extra spacing to tables. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         table,
CLIENT -> SERVER:         td {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             mso-table-lspace: 0pt !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             mso-table-rspace: 0pt !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Fixes webkit padding issue. Fix for Yahoo mail table alignment bug. Applies table-layout to the first 2 tables then removes for anything nested deeper. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         table {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             border-spacing: 0 !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             border-collapse: collapse !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             table-layout: fixed !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             margin: 0 auto !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER:         table table table {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             table-layout: auto;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Prevents Windows 10 Mail from underlining links despite inline CSS. Styles for underlined links should be inline. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         a {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             text-decoration: none;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Uses a better rendering method when resizing images in IE. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         img {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             -ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: A work-around for email clients meddling in triggered links. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         *[x-apple-data-detectors],  /* iOS */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         .unstyle-auto-detected-links *,
CLIENT -> SERVER:         .aBn {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             border-bottom: 0 !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             cursor: default !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             color: inherit !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             text-decoration: none !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             font-size: inherit !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             font-family: inherit !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             font-weight: inherit !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             line-height: inherit !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Prevents Gmail from displaying a download button on large, non-linked images. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         .a6S {
CLIENT -> SERVER:            display: none !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:            opacity: 0.01 !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:        }
CLIENT -> SERVER:        /* If the above doesn't work, add a .g-img class to any image in question. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:        img.g-img + div {
CLIENT -> SERVER:            display: none !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:        }

CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* Create one of these media queries for each additional viewport size you'd like to fix */
CLIENT -> SERVER:

CLIENT -> SERVER:                 height: auto !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:                 margin-left: auto !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:                 margin-right: auto !important;

CLIENT -> SERVER:         table {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             border-spacing: 0 !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             border-collapse: collapse !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             table-layout: fixed !important;

CLIENT -> SERVER:             table-layout: auto;

CLIENT -> SERVER:         a {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             text-decoration: none;

CLIENT -> SERVER:     /* What it does: Remove spaces around the email design added by some email clients. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* Beware: It can remove the padding / margin and add a background color to the compose a reply window. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         html,
CLIENT -> SERVER:         body {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             margin: 0 auto !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             padding: 0 !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             height: 100% !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             width: 100% !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER: 			font-family:Roboto;

CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Stops email clients resizing small text. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         * {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Centers email on Android 4.4 */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         div[style*="margin: 16px 0"] {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             margin: 0 !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Stops Outlook from adding extra spacing to tables. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         table,
CLIENT -> SERVER:         td {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             mso-table-lspace: 0pt !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             mso-table-rspace: 0pt !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Fixes webkit padding issue. Fix for Yahoo mail table alignment bug. Applies table-layout to the first 2 tables then removes for anything nested deeper. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         table {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             border-spacing: 0 !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             border-collapse: collapse !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             table-layout: fixed !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             margin: 0 auto !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER:         table table table {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             table-layout: auto;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Prevents Windows 10 Mail from underlining links despite inline CSS. Styles for underlined links should be inline. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         a {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             text-decoration: none;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Uses a better rendering method when resizing images in IE. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         img {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             -ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: A work-around for email clients meddling in triggered links. */

CLIENT -> SERVER:             border-bottom: 0 !important;

CLIENT -> SERVER:             line-height: inherit !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }

CLIENT -> SERVER:            display: none !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:            opacity: 0.01 !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:        }

CLIENT -> SERVER:         td {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             mso-table-lspace: 0pt !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             mso-table-rspace: 0pt !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER: 
CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Fixes webkit padding issue. Fix for Yahoo mail table alignment bug. Applies table-layout to the first 2 tables then removes for anything nested deeper. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         table {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             border-spacing: 0 !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             border-collapse: collapse !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             table-layout: fixed !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:             margin: 0 auto !important;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER:         table table table {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             table-layout: auto;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }

CLIENT -> SERVER:         /* What it does: Prevents Windows 10 Mail from underlining links despite inline CSS. Styles for underlined links should be inline. */
CLIENT -> SERVER:         a {
CLIENT -> SERVER:             text-decoration: none;
CLIENT -> SERVER:         }
CLIENT -> SERVER:

CLIENT -> SERVER:             -ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;
